revised_title: Phyto-Palaeontological Investigations of the Fossil Flora of Sheppey
tldr: The author investigates the fossil flora of Sheppey, discovering at least 72 genera and 200 species of plants. They find that the Sheppey flora, along with the Eocene flora of Great Britain, likely thrived in a subtropical climate. The author also identifies the relationships between extinct and existing plant genera, as well as the connections between fossils found in different localities.
